SourceString:
"From Aristonoe, your mentor and friend. 

You'll be relieved to know we won't be training this morning. The truth is, there's very little more I can teach you. 

Forgive me if it sounds sentimental. I never expected to raise a child, and I didn't know how. So I trained you instead. I taught you what I hoped would help you survive.

I know you have questions. About where you come from. About what all that training has been for. 

Meet me at the usual spot this afternoon, across the bridge. There is something I must show you."
A shrine to Hermes. Something is missing.

\"And it was foretold by the Fates that the son of Thetis would outstrip his father in glory, so no god wanted to associate with the nymph. But she married the mortal Peleus and when her son was born, she brought him to the shrine of divine mastery to receive his gifts. Achilles was his name, the greatest of all the Greeks.\"
Aristonoe took you fishing once, but neither of you managed to catch anything.
\"Patricus, you were the most loyal hound a man could ask for. Though you were still small, you had the heart of a lion.\"
